subject: Re: It's
msgSnippet: The apostrophe indicating a contraction is also generally omitted. Of course, the possessive apostrophe doesn t apply here since it s is never possessive. It
messageBody:
The apostrophe indicating a contraction is also
generally omitted.

Of course, the possessive apostrophe doesn't apply
here since "it's" is never possessive. It can only be a
contraction.


steveb_667 skribis:
>
> The possessive apostrophe is not used in Quikscript
> (Page #8 of the Quikscript manual).
>
> There are two ways of spelling "it's" - The Junior
> Quikscript method is letter #26 + #3 + #11. The
> Senior Quikscript method is #26 + #11.
>
> In general, all words are spelled as they would be
> pronounced correctly.
>
> danielfilan wrote:
> >
> > If you spell the word it the character it, how do
> > you spell it's? Same for she's, we're.

The apostrophe indicating a contraction is also
generally omitted.

Of course, the possessive apostrophe doesn't apply
here since "it's" is never possessive. It can only be a
contraction.
